SEARCH
Package main

Class Election

java.lang.Object
main.Election
public class Election extends Object
The Election class represents the electoral process that is carried out to determine the winning Candidate() determined by their respective Ballots().
Version:
3/15/2023
Author:
Carlos J. Pepin Delgado

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Election()
    Default constructor that creates an election based on the candidates in "candidates.csv" and the ballots "ballots.csv".
    Election(String candidates_filename, String ballot_filename)
    Constructor that receives the name of the candidate and ballot files and applies the election logic.

  • Constructor Details

    • Election

      public Election()
      Default constructor that creates an election based on the candidates in "candidates.csv" and the ballots "ballots.csv".

    • Election

      public Election(String candidates_filename, String ballot_filename)
      Constructor that receives the name of the candidate and ballot files and applies the election logic. Note: The files should be found in the input folder.

  • Method Details

    • getWinner

      public String getWinner()
      This class method returns the name of the winning candidate consists of three steps. First, it checks that there is no current candidate with more than 50% of the votes. Second, if not found, it proceeds to eliminate the candidate with the worst ranking, and to update the rankings of the other candidates. Third, it reclassifies the remaining candidates, to go back to step 1, until it finds the winner and return it.
      Returns:
      the name of the election winner

    • getEliminatedCandidates

      public interfaces.List<String> getEliminatedCandidates()
      This method returns total amount of ballots the list of names for the eliminated candidates with the numbers of 1s they had, in order of elimination.
      Returns:
      list of eliminated candidates

    • reclassification

      public void reclassification()
      This method reclassifies the remaining active candidates in the 2D List keeping the electoral process working until a winner is found.

    • min_Candidate

      public main.Candidate min_Candidate(data_structures.ArrayList<Integer> ranks_of_candidates)
      Searches for the candidate with the fewest votes of a rank already counted by the rank_Counter() class.
      Parameters:
      ranks_of_candidates -
      Returns:
      Candidate with the fewest votes to be eliminated (Candidate)

    • tie_Breaker

      public main.Candidate tie_Breaker(main.Candidate loser)
      This method breaks a tie between candidates w/ by using candidates ids.
      Parameters:
      loser - (Candidate for tie break)
      Returns:
      loser (Election loser for elimination) (Candidate)

    • printCandidates

      public void printCandidates(Function<main.Candidate,String> func)
      BONUS METHOD #1 This method takes a lambda function that receives a Candidate as a parameter and returns a String. The objective of the method is that it iterates over the list of candidates and prints the output of the lambda function for each candidate.
      Parameters:
      func - (lamda function) lamda=election#.printCandidates((c) -> c.getId() + " " + c.getName() + "" + ((c.isActive()) ? "" : "+"));

    • countBallots

      public int countBallots(Function<main.Ballot,Boolean> func)
      BONUS METHOD #2 This method takes a lambda function that receives a ballot and returns a Boolean. This method iterated through all the valid ballots and return how many ballots comply with a given condition.
      Parameters:
      func - (lamda function) lambas: countBallots((b) -> b.getRankByCandidate(1) == 2); countBallots((b) -> b.getRankByCandidate(2) == 2); countBallots((b) -> b.eliminate(3));

    • printBallotDistribution

      public void printBallotDistribution()
      This helper method prints all the general information about the election as well as a table with the vote distribution. Meant for helping in the debugging process.

    • outputTxtWriter

      public void outputTxtWriter()
      This method writes information related to the current election process in a separate generated -.txt file located in output. It includes number of total ballots, blank ballots, invalid ballots, eliminated candidates w/ #1's, and the election winner.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Main method that starts the project by creating an Election() Object.
      Parameters:
      args -
